protocol.description:
This protocol allows application components to ensure that there is only one swapchain for a wl_surface.
Components using this protocol should ensure that they never
- make wl_surface.attach requests, - create a wp_linux_drm_syncobj_surface_v1 extension, - create a wp_commit_timer_v1 extension, - create a wp_fifo_v1 extension, - create a wp_color_management_surface_v1 extension, or - create a wp_color_representation_surface_v1 extension
for a wl_surface unless they have acquired the lock. Furthermore, they should destroy all such extension objects before releasing the lock.

interface.name: wp_swapchain_lock_manager_v1
interface.description: A global interface for acquiring swapchain locks.

request.name: destroy
request.description: This has no effect on existing locks or lock requests.

request.name: request_lock

description.summary: requests the swapchain lock of a surface

request.description: Requests the swapchain lock of a surface.

interface.name: wp_swapchain_lock_request_v1
interface.description:
This object represents a request to acquire the advisory swapchain lock of a wl_surface.
Immediately after this object has been created, the compositor will send either the denied or the granted event.

event.name: denied
event.description: The request to acquire the lock was denied because another lock already exists.

event.name: granted
event.description: The request to acquire the lock was granted.

interface.name: wp_swapchain_lock_v1
interface.description: This object represents the advisory swapchain lock of a wl_surface. While this object exists, no other wp_swapchain_lock_v1 can be acquired for the wl_surface.

request.name: release
request.description: This request destroys the wp_swapchain_lock_v1 object and releases the lock.
